metadata.title: CVE-2021-28038 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.3, as used withXen PV. A certain part of the netback driver lacks necessary treatment oferrors such as failed memory allocations (as a result of changes to thehandling of grant mapping errors). A host OS denial of service may occurduring misbehavior of a networking frontend driver. NOTE: this issue existsbecause of an incomplete fix for CVE-2021-26931.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28038` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.94').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1').
